summary: This is a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team seeking to suppress identification testimony from 'Accuser 4'. The motion argues that the government's photo array procedure was unduly suggestive and that the accuser had never previously identified Maxwell in multiple interviews and legal proceedings over many years.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose defense team is filing this motion to suppress identification testimony from an accuser.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel on the motion and signed the filing.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel on the motion from HADDON, MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel on the motion from COHEN & GRESSER LLP.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel on the motion from Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the person Accuser 4 was asked about regarding abuse, and whose direction led to nude photographs being taken.

connections.description: Pagliuca is listed as defense attorney for Maxwell in this motion.
Menninger is listed as defense attorney for Maxwell in this motion.
Everdell is listed as defense attorney for Maxwell in this motion.
Sternheim is listed as defense attorney for Maxwell in this motion.
The motion references allegations that Maxwell was involved in Epstein's activities, though it disputes her involvement.

events.title: FBI Interview of Accuser 4
events.description: Accuser 4 was interviewed by FBI agents about abuse by Jeffrey Epstein but did not identify Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Government Photo Array Presentation
events.description: The government presented Accuser 4 with a series of photographs including one of Ghislaine Maxwell, which the defense argues was unduly suggestive.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Suppress
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files this motion to suppress identification testimony from Accuser 4.

keyFacts: Accuser 4 was first contacted by the FBI in 2007 and interviewed on August 7, 2007, but did not identify Ghislaine Maxwell at that time.
Accuser 4 filed lawsuits against Jeffrey Epstein that did not mention Ghislaine Maxwell, and during a deposition for those lawsuits, still did not identify Maxwell.
On June 23, 2021, the government presented Accuser 4 with a photo array that included Maxwell, which the defense argues was unduly suggestive and equivalent to a one-on-one show-up.
The defense motion argues that any identification of Maxwell by Accuser 4 should be suppressed due to the suggestive nature of the photo array and lack of prior identification over nearly 20 years.
The motion cites multiple legal precedents regarding due process rights and suggestive identification procedures, including Simmons v. United States and Neil v. Biggers.
